intro: Cremastosperma gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed grassvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by elongated, pod-like fruits. Native to various regions in the Mediterranean and parts of Asia, it thrives in dry, open habitats. Cremastosperma gracilipes is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
